text: An information system is a specialized system that collects, manipulates, and presents data and information to meet a given ________.
A computer-based information system consists of hardware, software, databases, telecommunications, people, and ________.
_____ refers to the physical layer of the information system.
The element of IS that includes operating systems and application programs is called ________.
Organized collections of facts and information are called ________.
_________ is used to organize data identified in previous phases to make it suitable for subsequent phases
________ enable the transmission of signals through computer networks.
Because people usually make the difference between success and failure, they are considered the most important element of ________.
Strategies, policies, methods, and rules for using an information system are defined as ________.
The process of creating or modifying systems is called ________.
Individuals or subjects that ultimately benefit from information system development projects are called ________.
The oldest software paradigm, usually called the ________ model, has its phases arranged linearly in sequential order.
The first phase of the traditional systems development life cycle is ________.
The final phase of the systems development life cycle that involves checking, changing, and enhancing the system is called ________.
A key step in the systems investigation phase that determines the probability of project success is called ________ analysis.
The most critical phase of the systems development life cycle is ________.
The ____________ stage focuses on business issues independent of any technology.
The output of systems analysis is a ________ model of the system.
__________ is a problem-solving technique decomposing a system into its component pieces for the purpose of analysis
In structured analysis, systems are described in terms of inputs, outputs, data, and ________.
The objective of requirement analysis is to reveal the requests of ________.
The PIECES framework classifies requirements into six categories: Performance, Information, Economy, Control, Efficiency, and ________.
In structured analysis, the most commonly used process modeling tool is the ________.
The highest-level data flow diagram showing system boundaries and major information flows is the ________ diagram.
The process of maintaining consistency between inputs and outputs during decomposition of DFDs is called ________.
In data modeling, the business needs to store ________ about entities (persons, places, events, etc...)
Attributes that can uniquely identify entities are known as ________.
Associations that exist between one or more entities are called ________.
The activity that answers the question of how the system will solve identified problems and requirements is called system ________.
The objective of the _______ phase is to physically put the system into operation
The two subphases of implementation are systems construction and systems ________.
The two subphases of implementation are systems ________ and systems implementation.
Testing performed by users to verify that the system works as required is called ________ testing.
The start-up model where the old system is stopped and the new one immediately starts is known as ________
The start-up model which involves continuous replacement is known as ________
The start up model which is availbale only for one group of users is known as ________
Running both the old and new systems simultaneously for a period is called ________
Changes in business processes, errors, new requests, or technical problems are common reasons for system ________.
The purpose of an _______ methodology is to clearly define activities, introduce consistency, and provide checkpoints for management.
During systems analysis, a data model is represented by an ________ diagram.
A primary key of another entity that is duplicated to identify a relationship is called a ________ key.
People, hardware, software, data, procedures, and telecommunications together form a ________ system.
